column4: i have strange problem , the cpu idle about 80% , but when try to execute command like ps -aux , it take long time  ?
top dont work at all , coz it take long time , i dont know why , i only can use vmstate 1 16 for example
try at boot selecting rescue kernel and then top or ps -aux
it is running server , i cant stop it
you might have to - worst case scenario would be someone else is controlling it...
are there log files to read?
and running mta-courier i can read the log file easily but when try to exectue some commands like ls or ps , top it take long time, using vmstate appear that cpu idle 80 %
don't know how else to help - thought the logs would let you know the processes that are using the cpu - 80% idle isn't right
yeah may vmstate not accurate in that !!!!
if the cpu is going at 80% then that will make progs slow to load
is this a new thing that's happening?
